IdentificationModule.BriefTitle: Allogeneic ABCB5-positive Stem Cells for Treatment of Epidermolysis Bullosa
IdentificationModule.OfficialTitle: An Interventional, Multicenter, Single Arm, Phase I/IIa Clinical Trial to Investigate the Efficacy and Safety of Allo-APZ2-EB on Epidermolysis Bullosa (EB)

DescriptionModule.BriefSummary: The aim of this clinical trial is to investigate the efficacy (by monitoring overall improvement of EB symptoms) and safety (by monitoring adverse events) of three doses of allo-APZ2-EB administered intravenously to patients with recessive dystrophic epidermolysis bullosa (RDEB).
DescriptionModule.DetailedDescription:
This is an interventional, single arm, non-randomized, open label, phase I/IIa clinical trial to investigate the efficacy and safety of the IMP allo-APZ2-EB in patients with RDEB.

Patients will undergo treatment with the IMP (three repeated intravenous applications) and will be followed up for efficacy for 12 weeks. To assess long-term safety of allo-APZ2-EB one follow-up visit at Month 12 and one follow-up visit at Month 24 post IMP applications is included.

Determination of the EB linked symptoms and quality of life will be assessed by using the EBDASI score, the iscorEB, the change in pain and itch perception, and patient's quality of life in EB. The wound healing process will be documented by photography.

ArmGroup.ArmGroupDescription: intravenous infusion, three doses of allo-APZ2-EB (2 x 10^6 cells/kg)

PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeMeasure: Overall improvement of EB symptoms after 12 weeks (measured by percentage change of a patient's EBDASI score), score), or last available post-baseline measurement if the Week 12 measurement is missing
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeDescription: EBDASI: epidermolysis bullosa disease activity and scarring index; measured in percentage change to baseline score
PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeTimeFrame: Week 12 post baseline, or last available post-baseline measurement if the Week 12 measurement is missing (last observation carried forward [LOCF])

PrimaryOutcome.PrimaryOutcomeDescription: All AEs occurring during the clinical trial will be registered, documented and evaluated.

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Overall improvement of EB symptoms after 12 weeks (measured by percentage change of a patient's EBDASI score)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: EBDASI: epidermolysis bullosa disease activity and scarring index; measured in percentage change to baseline score
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: between baseline and week 12 post baseline (without LOCF)

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Overall improvement of EB symptoms after 12 weeks (measured by percentage change of patient's iscorEB), or last available post-baseline measurement if the Week 12 measurement is missing
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: iscorEB: instrument for scoring clinical outcome of research for epidermolysis bullosa; measured in percentage change to baseline score
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: Week 12 post baseline, or last available post-baseline measurement if the Week 12 measurement is missing (LOCF);

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Overall improvement of EB symptoms after 12 weeks (measured by percentage change of patient's iscorEB)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: iscorEB: instrument for scoring clinical outcome of research for epidermolysis bullosa; measured in percentage change to baseline score
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: between baseline and week 12 post baseline (without LOCF)

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Overall improvement of EB symptoms at Day 17 (measured by percentage change of a patient's EBDASI score)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: EBDASI: epidermolysis bullosa disease activity and scarring index; measured in percentage change to baseline score
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: between baseline and day 17 post baseline

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Overall improvement of EB symptoms at Day 17 (measured by percentage change of a patient's iscorEB)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: iscorEB: instrument for scoring clinical outcome of research for epidermolysis bullosa; measured in percentage change to baseline score
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: between baseline and day 17 post baseline

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Overall improvement of EB symptoms at Day 35 (measured by percentage change of a patient's EBDASI score)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: EBDASI: epidermolysis bullosa disease activity and scarring index; measured in percentage change to baseline score
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: between baseline and day 35 post baseline

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Overall improvement of EB symptoms at Day 35 (measured by percentage change of a patient's iscorEB)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: iscorEB: instrument for scoring clinical outcome of research for epidermolysis bullosa; measured in percentage change to baseline score
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: between baseline and day 35 post baseline

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Inflammation (measured by panel of inflammation markers)
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: A panel of inflammation markers will be measured and evaluated.
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: between baseline and day 17, day 35 and week 12 post baseline

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Pain assessment as per numerical rating scale (NRS) will be evaluated.
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: between baseline and day 17, day 35 and week 12 post baseline

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Itch assessment as per numerical rating scale (NRS) will be evaluated.
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: between baseline and day 17, day 35 and week 12 post baseline

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Differences in patient's quality of life in EB
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Assessment of quality of life data using an EB-specific quality of life questionnaire
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: between baseline and day 17, day 35 and week 12 post baseline

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: A full physical examination will be performed and abnormal physical examination results will be evaluated and reported as AEs.
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: At Screening, baseline, day 17, day 35 and week 12

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Vital signs: Body temperature until Week 12;
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Body temperature will be evaluated at Screening, baseline, day 17, day 35 and week 12
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: At Screening, baseline, day 17, day 35 and week 12

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Vital signs: Blood pressure until Week 12;
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Blood pressure will be evaluated at Screening, baseline, day 17, day 35 and week 12
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: At Screening, baseline, day 17, day 35 and week 12

SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeMeasure: Vital signs: Heart rate until Week 12;
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeDescription: Heart rate will be evaluated at Screening, baseline, day 17, day 35 and week 12
SecondaryOutcome.SecondaryOutcomeTimeFrame: At Screening, baseline, day 17, day 35 and week 12
